segments.text: I notice the woman at the sink, completely engrossed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems unaware, even as water cascades over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus on drying that plate is almost admirable, but also concerning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, however, are up to something mischievous, and I feel a pang of guilt for watching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into that cookie jar, oblivious to how precarious his stance is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel my heart rate quickening as I contemplate the potential for a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister looks so hopeful, waiting eagerly for her prize.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s hard not to smile at their little shared secret, despite my unease.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the chaos inside and the calm garden outside is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman looks almost serene, while the children are on the edge of disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever realize what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a tension in the air, as if we’re all holding our breath.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think these moments are what make childhood so bittersweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s beautiful and terrifying all at once, this brief glimpse into their world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to reach out and stop them, but somehow I want them to go on.
segments.speaker: PAR
